subject: Sales
title: Richard Branson: The Adventurer Brand
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Richard Branson: The Adventurer Brand.

hook.text: Branson launched an airline by chartering a plane and selling seats to stranded passengers.

buildup.text: He turned himself into the product. Virgin meant fun, rebellion, and adventure. Just like him.

discovery.text: Every stunt â€” balloon flights, boat races, wild costumes â€” was a carefully planned sales event.

twist.text: Virgin failed in cola, vodka, and weddings. But the brand survived because Branson himself survived.

climax.text: He proved a personal brand can sell almost anything if the person behind it stays authentic.

punchline.text: He sold adventure. Products just came along for the ride.

quiz.question: Why did the Virgin brand survive despite many product failures?
options: Branson's authentic personal brand carried it
